text: from Jackie Kennedy to Nancy Reagan to
Hillary Clinton first ladies and their
first inaugural gowns have always caused
a stir there's huge pressure to get it
right and they eventually end up on
display of a Smithsonian Museum of
American history but this dress worn by
Michelle Obama has made history and
that's because it's her second inaugural
gown which will also go on display at
the Museum in Washington unlike second
gowns worn by previous first ladies
there's always an interest in what the
first lady's gonna wear it period what
the first lady is going to wear but
there's a real interest in what she
wears this for the second inauguration I
think it's people want to see does the
dress reflect anything she might have
learned there's no train on this dress
which had to have made it easier to move
around then it's a slimmer lined dress
and certainly doesn't have the amazing
beading that the first dress does so in
a lot of ways it was probably much
easier dress to wear it's thought the
shoe she wore a second time around when
noticeably shorter
I suspect that after living through the
first inauguration a lower heel probably
seemed like a wonderful idea since she
came onto the scene in 2008 Michelle
Obama's dress sense has drawn
international attention when she finally
steps out of the limelight it seems her
iconic style will be wrists lorna Blount
BBC news
